Description: Stela of 'Imy-dpt-bʒw (?): the surface of the stela is flat, but the upper part has been marked out to represent a cavetto-comice with palm-frond design. Below are five horizontal lines of text containing a standard, late funerary formula and a representation of the deceased standing with staff and sceptre, receiving an offering of a haunch from his son the lector-priest Mdw (or Ḥmw). The whole is carved in rather rough sunk relief. The name of the deceased which is written, apparently, at the end of the long vertical line of text on the right, is by no means certainly of the form given above.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: H G Fischer, JARCE 1 (1962), 8, n. 15. E Brovarski, 'Journal of Near Eastern Studies' 32 (1973), 456, 458, suggesting Abydos as provenance. B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' III (2) (Oxford: Clarendon Press), 742.
Bibliographic references: Scott-Moncrieff 1911 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 1. (Pl.41)
James 1961 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc. Part 1 (pl.34)
